title: 1  Introduction
text:
This is a book created from markdown and executable code.
See Knuth (1984) for additional discussion of literate programming.




Knuth, Donald E. 1984. “Literate Programming.” Comput. J. 27 (2): 97–111. https://doi.org/10.1093/comjnl/27.2.97.

title: 2  Summary
text: In summary, this book has no content whatsoever.

title: References
text:
Knuth, Donald E. “Literate Programming.” Comput.
J. 27, no. 2 (May 1984): 97–111. https://doi.org/10.1093/comjnl/27.2.97.

title: Making Indiana University
text:
How to Use
How to Access this Book in Other Formats

EPUB: click  in the left-hand sidebar

EPUB’s benefits include accessibility, manipulability (via eReader options), dynamic media, interactivity, reflowable text, and offline reading

PDF: click  in the left-hand sidebar

PDF’s benefits include printability of physical copies

Quarto Markdown (QMD): click  View source in the right-hand sidebar

QMD’s benefits include reusability (revising, remixing, reformatting, repurposing, etc.) via a universal format

TeX: click  View source in the right-hand sidebar; then in the left-hand sidebar, select Afterthought.tex

(La)TeX’s benefits include advanced document formatting and typesetting


How to Report a Problem (Technological, Accessibility, Textual, Etc.) with this Book
Click Report an issue in the right-hand sidebar of the HTML version; then complete and submit the bug report.
To Learn More
To learn more about how to use the HTML book, see Quarto’s Guide, or try its features.
